result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky D Bynum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Causing Injury, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Fine of $1,000.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges by August 10, 2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge as this case predates the change in law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricky D Bynum

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Ricky D Bynum
Current: 4625 N Hopkins St, Milwaukee, WI 53209 United States  (Effective: 03-21-2017)
Prior: 5517 North 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.  

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $1000.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges by August 10, 2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  

Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge as this case predates the change is law.  

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Ricky D Bynum in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.
filed, Reckles Driving (Causing Injury), contrary to sec. 346.62(3), 346.65(3) Wis. Stats. a U Misdemeanor.

Defendant Ricky D Bynum in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Final pre-trial conference held.   Case remains calendared for jury trial on August 10, 2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 26..

Defendant Ricky D Bynum in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Ricky D Bynum in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Alexander Klabunde. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
